definition: to benefit (e.g. the people)
to make/to build/to manufacture/to invent/to fabricate/to go to/party (in a lawsuit or legal agreement)/crop/classifier for crops
good fortune/happiness/luck
surname Fu/abbr. for Fujian province 福建省[Fu2 jian4 sheng3]
to benefit the community
to benefit thousands of people

sentences.english: Lu Ding tea, medicinal value and nutrients from the benefit of mankind.
sentences.chinese: 路丁茶從藥用價值與營養元素上造福人類。

sentences.english: The work of WHO is relevant in every country, benefits every country.
sentences.chinese: 世衛組織的工作涉及每個國家，也造福每個國家。

sentences.english: I wish to produce the secrets of nature and apply them for the happiness of man .
sentences.chinese: 我想揭破大天然的神祕，用來造福人類。

sentences.english: Love alone can work for man, and not against him.
sentences.chinese: 只有愛才能造福人類，而非危害人類。

sentences.english: You are on this planet to contribute to humanity with the gifts you have.
sentences.chinese: 你來到這個星球就是爲了用你的天賦來造福人類。

sentences.english: This is an invention that benefits mankind.
sentences.chinese: 這是一項造福人類的創造。

sentences.english: Improve the level of diagnosis and treatment of lithiasis, to benefit the people of Yunnan.
sentences.chinese: 提高結石病診療水平，造福雲南人民。

sentences.english: Make innovation a common cause, for the greater good of all.
sentences.chinese: 要讓創新成爲一種爲更大的整體造福的公共事業。

sentences.english: I strongly believe that reasonable animal testing is a good thing for society overall.
sentences.chinese: 我堅持認爲，合理的動物實驗是可以造福社會的。

sentences.english: Each era finds an improvement in law for the benefit of mankind.
sentences.chinese: 每個時代都會發現一項造福人類的法律進步。

sentences.english: We want oil to be used to benefit the country, to transform living conditions.
sentences.chinese: 我們應當讓石油造福於國民，改善人民的生活條件。

sentences.english: Another innovation that has been beneficial to developing countries is diagnostics in medicine.
sentences.chinese: 另一個一直在造福發展中國家的創新是醫學診斷學。

sentences.english: From the days of Leopold, Congolese resources rarely if ever have benefited the people of Congo.
sentences.chinese: 從利奧波德時代起，剛果的資源就很少造福剛果人。

sentences.english: Exterminate the sin, peaceful happiness, the everything is smooth, bringing benefit to the descendant.
sentences.chinese: 消滅罪障，平安吉祥，事事順利，造福後世。

sentences.english: So it ' s up to us to make science a blessing rather than a curse to mankind.
sentences.chinese: 讓科學造福而非引發禍端，這是我們的責任。

sentences.english: The benefit for the purpose, benevolent love.
sentences.chinese: 以造福世界爲宗旨，仁者愛人。

definition: well-being/welfare
to benefit both the country and the people
no end of virtuous achievements (idiom); boundless beneficence
lit. contribute bricks and tiles for a building (idiom)/fig. to do one's bit to help
throughout the ages
to live in peace and work happily (idiom)
practice medicine or pharmacy to help the people or public
meritorious deed/benevolent act
to enhance/to promote/to enrich
to treat the disease to save the patient/to criticize a person in order to help him
to work for/to devote one's efforts to
variant of 弘揚|弘扬[hong2 yang2]
to develop/to make full use of
to accumulate merit/to do good/to give to charity/virtuous actions
to have bad consequences
all the people
